Listerinos-

If anyone knows or has contacts in Japan who might
now, I would like to have (or assemble) a bio for a
modern tsuba-ko names Issei Naruki.

He once lived in Mino (Gifu prefecture) and I'd like
to learn is birth date, if he is still alive, how his
work is regarded in Japan, etc.
   Replies off list are welcome.

I have a rubbing of a poem by him on one of his tsuba.
I'd like to get it translated, but had no luck so far.
I suspect that might have been plagerized off a
Nobuiye tsuba, but have not yet found a an image of an
identical Nobuiye (just a similar one).

Any and all help welcome.

Curran
